items.checkin_comment: Alright. Another average bitter. Tastes a tiny bit hoppy with some tang that hangs around. Medium carbonation. A lot of malt around. Bottle from lcbo.

user.bio: Mostly on Ratebeer as solidfunk. Also freelance beer stories for Smithsonian Mag, Virginia Craft Beer.

beer.beer_description:
Dry-Hopped Pale

Golden - Snappy - Citrus

Colour: 12 Units
Food Partner: King Prawn Dhansak
Spirit: Devotion

A zesty body and citrus aroma with a snappy finish. Drink to inspire you to an evening of passion!

Circa 500BC, during the Celtic Golden Age, most of mainland Europe was dominated by spiritual tribes of Celtic origin.

items.checkin_comment: pissy, highly carbonated and very astringent aftertaste. Smells of sickening ly sweet maple syrup and looks like lager with food colouring. Has some malt sense.

Biscuit - Tangerine - Spice

Colour: 30 Units
Food Partner: Lamb Shanks

Big malt body meets orange flavours. Citrus with a touch of delicate spice.

items.badge_description: Sometimes you need a break from all the hops, fruits, and spices. What better way than with a crisp, smooth Blonde Ale or Golden Ale? Basic but delicious. That's 80 different beers with the style of Blonde Ale or Golden Ale. Try 5 more for Level 17!
Had enough tea and biscuits? Head to the pub for a pint! That's at least 200 beers from the UK. Try 5 more for Level 41.

items.badge_description: Traveling the world is hard, but not for you. It's as easy as cracking open a new brew! You have had a beer from at least 145 different regions around the world. Try 5 more for Level 30!

Whether you’re feeling extra special or extra strong, stopping by the local pub for a delicious Extra Special / Strong Bitter or English Bitter is always a good decision! That's 20 different beers with the style of Extra Special / Strong Bitter or English Bitter. Try 5 more for Level 5!

beer.beer_description: Amber ale with big Cascade and Amarillo hopping for citrus and floral flavour and aroma. The first in the Otherworld series of session beers for 2016.

Red Table Ale

Robust - Passionfruit - Roast

Colour: 38 Units
Food Partner: Crayfish Salad
Spirit: Contentment

A deep aromatic and fruity beer with hints of passion fruit.

In an age where Romans witnessed druids. When sacrifice, ritual and cultures met. When ages welcomed magic.

Resinous Mild Ale

Chocolate - Caramel - Spice

Colour: 93 Units
Food Partner: Belgian Chocolate Mousse
Spirit: At Peace

Elegant smooth chocolate and caramel body with a spice finish. Inspired by the tranquility of the myths of Avalon.

The legends of King Arthur and Merlin emerge from ancient Pagan myths, tracing dark ripples through history.

Pale Ale

Hoppy - Pine - Tropical Fruit
Colour: 8 Units
Food Partner: Fillet Steak
Spirit: Optimism

Powerfully hopped with sweet malt and a depth of tropical fruit aroma dry hop.

Silures were a powerful Celtic tribe from todays South Wales and stood tall against Roman Invasion.

Indian Pale Ale

Colour: 14 Units
Food Partner: Caerphilly Cheese
Spirit: Curiousity

A commanding IPA balancing bitterness, sweetness and a grapefruit finish.

King Bleddyn, most merciful of all Welsh kings lived and ruled until 1075, the number of our original gravity.

Dry-Hopped Pale

Golden - Snappy - Citrus

Colour: 12 Units
Food Partner: King Prawn Dhansak
Spirit: Devotion

A zesty body and citrus aroma with a snappy finish. Drink to inspire you to an evening of passion!

Circa 500BC, during the Celtic Golden Age, most of mainland Europe was dominated by spiritual tribes of Celtic origin.
Organic Ale

Dry hopped pale ale.

The site of La Tène on the North side of Lake Neuchatel in Switzerland, where belief and spirit was born.
Low ABV Pale Ale with oats, hopped with mosaic, and infused with lemon peel.

Dry Hopped ESB

Biscuit - Tangerine - Spice

Colour: 30 Units
Food Partner: Lamb Shanks
Spirit: Anticipation

Big malt body meets orange flavours. Citrus with a touch of delicate spice.

At the eye of the storm in the depth of legend, 1400. Owain Glyndwr, Welsh Ruler, conquered Saxon invaders. His legend forever remains.
Amber with a thin white head; lemony citrus aroma; resinous piney taste with a slightly oily body; and a sharp grapefruit bitterness; then some sour rye and the faintest hint of smoke on the finish.
Described as a Exotic Triple brewed with Belgium Yeast with Orange and Cinnamon flavours.

A rich pink, strawberry, loganberry and raspberry Farmhouse Saison. Sour mashed and aged for weeks with fresh fruit for a crisp and dry finish. Damara, sacred goddess of vitality and growth, inspired new fruit in May.

Farmhouse Fruit Saison
Fruit-Tart-Pomegranate
Colour: 20 units
Food Partner: Goats Cheese Canneloni
A resinous saison with a tart fruitiness and pomegranate finish. 

Hallstatt was a settlement and Celtic culture in Western Europe from 800-600BC, when druids held the power and spirits roamed.

A farmhouse blackcurrant saison, soured with lactobacillus and aged in blackcurrant and brettanomyces. The Blood Moon, a Time for inner cleansing. The time of first frosts and final harvests and the ultimate sacrifice of the Harvest King.
"Magestic IPA", 95 IBUs, American yeast, big world hops and Euro malt.
Dry-hopped Session Rye IPA
Session pale ale with Chinook, brewed for the 6 Nations.

BrewDog Collabfest 2014. 

For the second year running, we have teamed our UK fleet of bars up with amazing local breweries to brew the biggest en masse collaboration effort known to man! 16 UK BrewDog bars, 16 breweries and 16 beers!

BrewDog Cardiff & Celt Experience created Home of the Fruitcakes a Strawberry & raspberry saison (with a ton of fruit. Like, a literal ton)
Dry hopped session pale ale
A second collab brew with Brasseries St Germain, a deep rye porter brewed with French Cascade hops. A sweet chocolate character with spicy cascade hops Brewed February 2014 in Page 24, Aix-Noulette.
A Czech style Lager with a clean bitterness and a Noble/Saaz hop presence. Finishes with a citrus and berry dry-hop aroma
Chocolate Milk Porter infused with Kaffir Lime leaves. Rich and luxurous, with a fresh fruity hit of lime.

A psychadelic Wild Welsh beer brewed in collaboration with the Super Furry Animals. It is scheduled to be a high abv champagne beer using a Wild Welsh yeast. The yeast discovered by head brewer Tom Newman in conjunction with experimental project ‘Cell Rebirth’ and Melissa Cole.
